definition: stairway to heaven/high mountain road/tall ladder on a building or other large structure/space elevator

sentences.english: Could not climb on the ladder leading to love.
Ladder of love, this mountain has added a romantic.
sentences.chinese: 爱情天梯的存在，更为这片山林增添了一抹浪漫色彩。

sentences.english: Classical is the leaven of spirit and the ladder to wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 名著是精神的酵母，智慧的天梯。

sentences.english: New Uniques, new Ladder Characters, many more new things.
sentences.chinese: 新的暗金，新天梯人物，非常多新东西。

sentences.english: May you build a ladder to the stars.
sentences.chinese: 保佑你建造摘星的天梯。

sentences.english: They just can't trade or play with ladder characters.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是不能和新天梯人物交易或游戏。

sentences.english: Climb the heavens to the clouds and we will play with angels.
sentences.chinese: 搭个天梯到云端，让我们一起与天使游玩。

sentences.english: Fantasy is the poet's wings, hypothesis is the ladder of science.
sentences.chinese: 幻想是诗人的翅膀，假设是科学的天梯。

sentences.english: The Heavenly Ladder is rather steep and precipitous. Please don't run, jump, and fight playfully during the climbing.
sentences.chinese: 上天梯较为险陡，请不要在攀登的过程中跑跳打逗。

sentences.english: If compare up to heaven, self-study is the ladder of success.
sentences.chinese: 如果把成才比作登天，自学便是成才的天梯。

sentences.english: Another two in the North as a slope "on the ladder" in the sidewall.
sentences.chinese: 另外两尊在北山坡一处称为“上天梯”的侧壁上。

sentences.english: The higher you gaze up the corporate ladder, the fewer women you see.
sentences.chinese: 你越往事业天梯的上面看，女性的身影就越来越少。

definition: to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
rank/class/(Japanese martial arts and board games) dan
plank walkway constructed on the face of a cliff/(archaic) elevated passageway connecting the upper levels of adjacent towers
